text_en: Other Phencyclidine-Induced Disorders 251 Other Phencyclidine-Induced Disorders Other phencyclidine-induced disorders are described in other chap- ters of the book with disorders with which they share phenomenol- ogy (see the substance/medication-induced mental disorders in these chapters): phencyclidine-induced psychotic disorder (“Schizophre- nia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders”); phencyclidine- induced bipolar disorder (“Bipolar and Related Disorders”); phency- clidine-induced depressive disorder (“Depressive Disorders”); and phencyclidine-induced anxiety disorder (“Anxiety Disorders”). For phencyclidine-induced intoxication delirium, see the criteria and dis- cussion of delirium in the chapter “Neurocognitive Disorders.” These phencyclidine-induced disorders are diagnosed instead of phencycli- dine intoxication only when the symptoms are sufficiently severe to warrant independent clinical attention.
